title: Oversamples
description: Key group(s) given higher odds of selection into a probability sample than would occur by chance, allowing for both within- and between-group comparisons in the resulting data.
usageNotes: Do not mark as an oversample if the study is about a particular group by design (e.g., a study of crime victims is not an oversample of crime victims but may contain oversamples for race or age).
